seg-source.mrk: Booting an encrypted database

target.mrk: Booting an encrypted database

trans-unit.source: If you create an encrypted database using the bootPassword=key attribute, you must specify the boot password to reboot the database. If you create an encrypted database using the encryptionKey=key attribute, you must specify the encryption key to reboot the database.

seg-source.mrk: If you create an encrypted database using the bootPassword=key attribute, you must specify the boot password to reboot the database.
If you create an encrypted database using the encryptionKey=key attribute, you must specify the encryption key to reboot the database.

target.mrk: If you create an encrypted database using the bootPassword=key attribute, you must specify the boot password to reboot the database.
If you create an encrypted database using the encryptionKey=key attribute, you must specify the encryption key to reboot the database.

seg-source.mrk: encrypted databases

target.mrk: encrypted databases

seg-source.mrk: booting

target.mrk: booting

trans-unit.source: Encrypted databases cannot be booted automatically along with all other system databases on system startup (see "derby.system.bootAll" in the ). Instead, you boot an encrypted database when you first connect to the database.

seg-source.mrk: Encrypted databases cannot be booted automatically along with all other system databases on system startup (see "derby.system.bootAll" in the ).
Instead, you boot an encrypted database when you first connect to the database.

target.mrk: Encrypted databases cannot be booted automatically along with all other system databases on system startup (see "derby.system.bootAll" in the ).
Instead, you boot an encrypted database when you first connect to the database.

trans-unit.source: Booting a database with the bootPassword=key attribute

seg-source.mrk: Booting a database with the bootPassword=key attribute

target.mrk: Booting a database with the bootPassword=key attribute

trans-unit.source: To access an encrypted database called <codeph>wombat</codeph> that was created with the boot password <codeph>clo760uds2caPe</codeph>, use the following connection URL:

seg-source.mrk: To access an encrypted database called <codeph>wombat</codeph> that was created with the boot password <codeph>clo760uds2caPe</codeph>, use the following connection URL:

target.mrk: To access an encrypted database called <codeph>wombat</codeph> that was created with the boot password <codeph>clo760uds2caPe</codeph>, use the following connection URL:

seg-source.mrk: jdbc:derby:wombat;bootPassword=clo760uds2caPe

target.mrk: jdbc:derby:wombat;bootPassword=clo760uds2caPe

trans-unit.source: Booting a database with the encryptionKey=key attribute

seg-source.mrk: Booting a database with the encryptionKey=key attribute

target.mrk: Booting a database with the encryptionKey=key attribute

trans-unit.source: To access an encrypted database called <codeph>flintstone</codeph> that was created with the attributes <codeph>encryptionKey=c566bab9ee8b62a5ddb4d9229224c678</codeph> and <codeph>encryptionAlgorithm=AES/CBC/NoPadding</codeph>, use the following connection URL:

seg-source.mrk: To access an encrypted database called <codeph>flintstone</codeph> that was created with the attributes <codeph>encryptionKey=c566bab9ee8b62a5ddb4d9229224c678</codeph> and <codeph>encryptionAlgorithm=AES/CBC/NoPadding</codeph>, use the following connection URL:

target.mrk: To access an encrypted database called <codeph>flintstone</codeph> that was created with the attributes <codeph>encryptionKey=c566bab9ee8b62a5ddb4d9229224c678</codeph> and <codeph>encryptionAlgorithm=AES/CBC/NoPadding</codeph>, use the following connection URL:

seg-source.mrk: jdbc:derby:flintstone;encryptionKey=c566bab9ee8b62a5ddb4d9229224c678

target.mrk: jdbc:derby:flintstone;encryptionKey=c566bab9ee8b62a5ddb4d9229224c678

trans-unit.source: After the database is booted, all connections can access the database without the boot password. Only a connection that boots the database requires the key.

seg-source.mrk: After the database is booted, all connections can access the database without the boot password.
Only a connection that boots the database requires the key.

target.mrk: After the database is booted, all connections can access the database without the boot password.
Only a connection that boots the database requires the key.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following connections would boot the database and require the boot password or encryption key, depending on what mechanism was used to encrypt the database originally:

trans-unit.source: The first connection to the database in the JVM session

seg-source.mrk: The first connection to the database in the JVM session

target.mrk: The first connection to the database in the JVM session

trans-unit.source: The first connection to the database after the database has been explicitly shut down

seg-source.mrk: The first connection to the database after the database has been explicitly shut down

target.mrk: The first connection to the database after the database has been explicitly shut down

trans-unit.source: The first connection to the database after the system has been shut down and then rebooted

seg-source.mrk: The first connection to the database after the system has been shut down and then rebooted

target.mrk: The first connection to the database after the system has been shut down and then rebooted

trans-unit.source: The boot password and the encryption key are not meant to prevent unauthorized connections to the database after the database is booted. To protect a database after it has been booted, turn on user authentication (see <xref href="cdevcsecure42374.dita#cdevcsecure42374"></xref>).

seg-source.mrk: The boot password and the encryption key are not meant to prevent unauthorized connections to the database after the database is booted.
To protect a database after it has been booted, turn on user authentication (see <xref href="cdevcsecure42374.dita#cdevcsecure42374"></xref>).

target.mrk: The boot password and the encryption key are not meant to prevent unauthorized connections to the database after the database is booted.
To protect a database after it has been booted, turn on user authentication (see <xref href="cdevcsecure42374.dita#cdevcsecure42374"></xref>).
